data.title: MTV EMAs 2015: Five things we learned
data.meta_description: Duran Duran get legendary status and Ed Sheeran's dirty jokes
data.text:
The MTV EMAs, Europe's answer to the entertainment giant's raucous summer video awards, took place on Sunday night in Milan. Here's who won, lost, and performed on stage with Italy's most famous blind tenor:

Ruby Rose and Ed Sheeran are showbiz's new awkward hosts

In 2011, Anne Hathaway and James Franco mangled the Oscars' opening monologue. Three years later, Ellie Goulding and Louis Hamilton's bumbling overshadowed Madonna falling off stage while presenting at the Brit Awards. Now Sheeran and Australian model and actress Ruby Rose have followed suit.

The British pop star and Orange is the New Black actress had a provocative script to work from, with Sheeran responding "that's a beautiful pussy" to Rose's claim that she was "as cute as a kitten".

Sheeran kept the innuendo coming throughout the awards, asking if Rose wanted to hide a banana he had brought on stage. Rose tried her best to keep up, but some of the jokes fell flat, namely when she introduced the Best Video award presenters, Tinie Tempah, Hailey Baldwin and Bianca Balti: "Here are two girls, one rapper… wonder how many hits that would get on YouTube."

Tori Kelly performed several times – once with Andrea Bocelli

While US audiences witnessed YouTube pop star Kelly perform only with her own band – a medley of 90s hip-hop hits including No Scrubs and Ready or Not, as well as her hit Should've Been Us – Europe saw her on strage with Italian tenor Andrea Bocelli.

Bocelli and Kelly performed Just Give me a Reason, the 2012 duet made famous by Pink and Nate Ruess.

Justin Bieber's return continues unabated

After quietly releasing a couple of well-received singles, Bieber staged his big comeback at the VMAs in August, and managed to impress most people, and then have a little cry on stage. Three months later and Bieber was one of the big EMA winners of the year, scooping up Best Look, Biggest Fans, Best Stage Award and Best Male.

The 21-year-old, who also performed What Do You Mean at the ceremony, showed his new, mature side while accepting the awards. After picking up Best Male, he said: "It's been a long couple of years, um, I just feel like this is pretty awesome to be recognised for my music."

Nicki Minaj wasn't overly bothered about winning an MTV EMA

Minaj was applauded for pointing out the lack of diversity in this year's VMA nominations, but her pre-recorded acceptance speech for Best Hip-Hop EMA suggested she wasn't as fussed about the European awards.

After thanking her fans, Minaj apathetically mentioned that she wished she was in Milan to eat some "um, spaghetti", sparking a similar lack of enthusiasm among those Twitter-users watching.

Duran Duran are officially "visionary"

The 1980s boy band became the first winners of the MTV Visionary Award, which recognised their "strong visual presence" with videos for songs such as Hungry Like the Wolf and Girls on Film. All four band-members were in Milan to collect the award, and Simon Le Bon commented: "When we started there was us and MTV and we blazed a trail and we were there for each other."
